[h1]Overwatch is like seeing your superhero in action. Overwatch 2 is like meeting your superhero in real life.
Never meet your heroes.[/h1]

The first game was something cool and in some ways even new; even though hero shooters have been out there for a long while, it had it's charm and brought people to play this game. Of course, like every game, people have been losing interest, because the same thing over and over got boring, but it still was quite enjoyable. The thrill of opening a lootbox after levelling up, playing new modes with innovative mechanics, mixing up ultimate abilities to create crazy combinations; it [u]was[/u] fun.

The first game died so much that devs became desperate enough that they announced a second game with a promise of PvE, which everyone found exciting, because the missions presented to that time were fun to play. So, they closed the first game and launched the second.

The PvE was, of course, delayed which was okay, because we were getting new content at the time. There was hype for the new release, but soon after; I can vouch for the word: immediatelly people noticed that it's the same thing. Same mechanics, same playstyles, they just removed 2 slots from your typical Overwatch matchmaking game and added new characters. Not only that, but devs also decided to put everything and I mean everything that was free behind a paywall; characters, charms, lootboxes, skins. You name it. You practically can't get anything new without spending real money for this game. They replaced beloved by community free lootboxes with a pathetic battlepass. Their excuse is that the mythic skin (the last reward you get) takes "very long" to make. Which is understandable, but it's only one skin for one character, nothing else. They've added nothing that was worth of people's interest. They ruined the balance of the game by removing stuns, nerfing the existing characters and adding incredibly powerful characters behind, would you guess it? A paywall or a lot of hours of grind. Nevertheless people who pay have the advantage. 

Worst part? They've broken their promises, cancelled the only thing that people were hyped for and now Overwatch (2) became a poor excuse of a cash grab game.

Overwatch 2 is like a toxic relationship I CANT get out of. 

I know Blizzard is disrespecting me, they do NOTHING the community asks for, breaking their promises, no real apologys, permanently showing they dont care.... - but I cant stop. I love and hate this game at the same time. 

It hurts to give a bad review, because of my infinite love for this game (over 700 hours +++ in battlenet)  BUT the politics behind are SO disgusting. They just want money without providing real value. I wont give blizzard any money, no matter how awesome a battlepass could be, because I have NO PAYPIG FETISH!!!! ....But im also not strong enough to stop playing it.:(

PLS wake up blizzard!!!! I know you dont care about my feelings but a small part of me cant stop believing that you maybe one day will change....

To this day, I still can't figure out what the "2" in Overwatch 2 truly means. Is it, x2 the size of Overwatch 1? x2 the price of Overwatch 1? 1 + 1 = Overwatch 2? What it is exactly?

Anyway, this sucks and here's why,
[list]
    [*] New heroes must be grind to unlock or buy, they're no longer free
    [*] Battle/Season pass sucks no matter the game its on
    [*] Expensive skins
    [*] Story mode must be bought to access
    [*] Story mode cost SGD$22.40 for a nugget size story of what was [u]promised[/u]
    [*] From 6v6 to 5v5
    [*] The constant unnecessary nerfs
    [*] Skill Based Matchmaking (SBMM) doesn't work and therefore it sucks
[/list]

I put more effort into sh!tting in the morning than Overwatch 2 does with its delivery of its content. The current game director, Aaron Keller, is an incompetent buffoon with a fancy job title and is doing a terrible job and it shows in the game. Why I say this? Cause anyone with half a brain don't throw out 4 years worth of work that you promise to your clients, only to give out to your clients chicklet size products that can be done in under a year, then ask them to pay a ridiculous amount for that chicklet size product, then make excuses of technical difficulties. I've seen more passion and effort from an indie studio than a AAA studio like Blizzard.

I'll continue to play Overwatch 2 as it's core gameplay is still solid. It's just the way that they give us this newer content has to change. The Story Mode should've been free and available right from the launch of Overwatch 2. Making us pay for every small chunks of the Story Mode that is going to be release in the future is not how you win back players. And no amount of gay, transgender, they/them or whatever gender fluid character nonsense they gonna shove in the game is gonna help.

a joke of a game that was updated only to fomo bait. Never delivered on the PVE with the skill trees and whatnot, instead we just got microtransaction hell, where even the new mediocre PVE  mode they delivered costs 15 dollars, on top of it costing 19+ dollars for a single skin. For those that actually bought the game when it was OW1, we get literally nothing. At least in OW1 we could get free lootboxes and have up to 4 chances of a skin, as well as already free pve expansions like archives and whatnot, also chances of earning event skins for free while only having to have paid the price of only the base game. Blizzards a circus, and they have been for years now.  They've even somehow made Diablo a mediocre franchise over the years as well.
